page.title: 06RHUM COMMUNITY HALL
page.content: This hall sits at the head of the bay. In the Rhum Community Hall there are sometimes slide shows about the island so visitors can see them. The Archaeologists also hold slide shows about their work. Feature films are shown once a month. There are often ceilidhs where people enjoy dancing. The biggest dance is the New Year Ceilidh. Near the end of this everyone sings and plays music. There is also something to eat and drink. At the normal ceilidh people do not have something to eat. Occasionally cruise ships call at Rhum and people come ashore to have a look round. Then they come into the hall where locals serve food and drink. At Christmas a special party is held for the children where the adults play the music for the games and they make the food.
